Reviews.Title: “Appalling !!”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I booked in last w/e for a 'theatre' w/e. It was dreadful. We were sent to the 'annexe' on the 2nd floor. I nearly fell down the stairs as the bannister came away from the wall. Our room was less than basic-----a 'cupboard' really. No complimentary toiletries---ha! ha! A VERY small bar of soap and towels the size of flannels ! No 'drinks' facilities----not even a glass for water !! Mattresses the size of a biscuit ! The lights were broken. The ceiling was badly soiled/cracked. Do not go there--EVER. jane

Reviews.Title: “AVOID...BED BUGS ROOM 36”
Reviews.Author: 504115Rachel
Reviews.Content: If you stay here the location is great,but the bed was crawling with bed bugs,its more like a place for the homeless...I felt dirty after my stay, had to put all my clothes in the wash straight away in fear I brought bed bugs home. Shared shower rooms were clean, I reccomend paying a bit extra for piece of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: MollieMoo2012
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that had bed bugs or some kind of lice. Absolutely disgusting rooms. Never ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dated, the pits!!”
Reviews.Author: aggcardiff
Reviews.Content: GOOD GOD!! My good friend booked this and didn't read the reviews (gracias JC!). It was sooo terrible it was actually comical. FILTHY dated rooms with 'hand made' 'furniture'. Think pieces of plywood nailed together by simpletons. DIRTY curtains, FILTHY carpets, DATED decor. I'm really not that fussy, it was cheapish and in a great location. But for £30 more (between two?) you could get a great 'top secret' deal in a 4 star establishment. The room was a tiny triple. I can't really see how anyone could possibly share it in a group of three given that an extra tenner each would yield a lovely hotel from 'lastminute' or some such website. As for the staff. The receptionists could barely acknowledge you as they were too busy nattering on the phone. They can't even look after your luggage safely. You have to entrust them in a totally open living area where ANYONE could walk in and take them. SO bad it was funny. PLEASE avoid - this really won't do and the owners need a wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Crawling with Bed Bugs.....Do not stay here it is FILTHY!”
Reviews.Author: Parchy73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some poor hotels in my time but this one tops them all. Environmental Health should be taking a good look at this hotel. How it is allowed to stay open I will never know. With the Olympics this year god help anyone who books this hotel as you will be in for a diabolical stay. The beds are crawling with bed bugs, the room is absolutely filthy! Come on London we are in the modern days not medieval times, somebody sort this hotel out for the pride of Britain please. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had checked on here before I booked as a show/hotel break”
Reviews.Author: Sandra C
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights here as part of a show/hotel break through just London theatre breaks so I will not use them again either. This hotel is just disgusting do not go there!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER stay here!”
Reviews.Author: catcc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting in every way. It is dirty and I have never in my life experienced such bad service. The rooms are awful and I would recommend that anyone looking for a cheap hotel, spends an extra few pounds and stays elsewhere as this our stay was a horrible experience. When we returned to the 'hotel' (more like a shabby hostel) we were unable to get the door to open and they key was not working. We contacted staff who came and had a look and after a few attempts say they would have to wait until 9am the next morning to fix it!! Luckily, we had friends staying in another room so we all squashed together and the others had to go to another hotel! Gresham hotel did NOT refund ANY of our money!!!!! I was appauled that we had to sleep in an empty room with out belongings locked in our original room. This place made me very angry ... I think the other reviews here sum it up (if only the friend who booked it had taken a look!)

Reviews.Title: “At least Fawlty Towers was clean !”
Reviews.Author: philrobinson
Reviews.Content: My partner commentated below under "filthy filthy filthy " . I have never stayed in a hotel so disgusting ! I have worked with the homeless in the past and I have seen cleaner night shelters.I saw the cockroach too and as a result am contacting Environmental Health.The hotel should be worried about this as I will not rest until the premises are improved or closed down .It needs to be closed down as visitors from abroad should not have this place as an initial idea of UK hotel standards ! In the hotel lobby it has stuck on a window...rated by trip advisor .....it certainly is .......rated as AWFUL ! Do not use this place .We left the place at 7am because we wanted to get into the London Street which was cleaner ! We could have come back to try to get a refund when the manager came at 8 am but felt that it was a waste of time as others on here had been promised a refvund but never recieved it .Well after I have finished with them they will wish they had !

Reviews.Title: “Filthy youth hostel like place with rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: espressotea
Reviews.Content: While I know that 50 GBP isn't much when it comes to lodging in London, esp. that this place is close to the train station and the British Museum, but this 50 GBP is only for a room with no bathroom. For this price for a room with shared bathrooms, I expect much better cleanliness. The worst part is actually that I booked a single room with bathroom for 60 GBP and already paid partially online, but when I arrived at 9pm they told me all the rooms with bathrooms are gone because a few of such rooms have bathrooms issues and not available that night (not sure if true at all). They said they only have rooms with shared bathrooms left and would give me a 10 GBP discount, and take it or leave it. For this kind of room in such an old and unclean establishment, the 50 GBP price is too high. However, the receptionist was not apologetic and was extremely rude. At 9pm I of course had no choice but to take it. The room was small, which is fine, but it is very old and I would only give it ~50% on cleanliness. The shared bathrooms are tiny, old, and not clean. Overall, it is worst than a college dorm. I would not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Filthy, Mucky. HOSTEL not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mon1987
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually the worse hotel i'v stayd in. The walls are dirty, the floor is dirty, the bed is dirty, the furniture is dirty, the windows are dirty. I didnt dere touch anything, i didnt unpack my clothes as i was scared something would crawl onto them. the bed sheet had wet patch when we arrived. we just got changed and went strate out. we arrived back my partner had to walk me to the toliet as i was scared of going on my own. The guests their are clearly TRAMP type of people. The shared toliet is dirty. We went to bed but could hear every word the people was sayin in the other room. and everything they was doing (having sex). I finally droped off but got woken up 1 hour later buy someone in the shared toliet been sick and moanin with pain really loud, i was really scared. my stomac was curning i was that scared. I never went bak to sleep, so i had 1 hour sleep the whole night. Dustbin van came at 6am and it sounded like the whole house was going to fall down it was that loud. I woke my partner up and said i just want to get out of hear so we got changed and left at 7am and went into london for breakfast. you get what you pay for. location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a fair reviewer and have a knack of finding the good in everything. The good in this is the location, it is in a close proximity to the West End and its walking distance to all theatres along with its extremely cheap prices (for London anyway) leaves it a good option if trying to do things on a tight low budget. We actually booked the Lonsdale on Bedford Place, but on arrival there we were told of problems with the hotel rooms and were redirected to the Gresham, we were shown our room, a twin, in the basement of the hotel, in stank, had no natural light and was next to the kitchens. No way!! we asked for another option so we were shown 2 singles next to each other on the 2nd floor, first thoughts were very basic student accomodation, cheap mattresses that you can feel every spring on and bedding fit for the police cells, TVs with not one watchable channel, and the noise was remarkable, all night long buses, lorries, police car sirens, revellers, bin wagons, needless to say I personally got no rest and just wanted to go home! I wish I had gone home or at least set off and found a good hotel outside London for half the price and got some sleep. This place could easily be a hostel for the social services, they seem to prey on visitors from overseas too (prices in Euros), once your there they have you! At least they show the room before completing the payment so you can walk if you want, my advice is walk! have a back up plan and go to it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here often”
Reviews.Author: 53Tina
Reviews.Content: For travellers on a budget this is a very good choice. The location is perfect for visiting the British Museum , Covent Garden, Oxford Street, Chinatown and even Trafalgar Square and the Thames. It is also good for people travelling via Euston not wanting to use the underground as it is an easy level walk or bus ride - bus stops almost outside the door. This is not a luxury hotel and possibly would not be my first choice for a romantic weekend but is ideal for somewhere to sleep after a busy day in the city.The sheets are clean and tidy. Other hotels in the vicinity charge at least three times the price. Traffic noise may be a problem for some but I am usually too tired to notice so sleeping here is not a problem for me and normally I live in the countryside. A vast selection of places to eat are very close at hand. There are information guides available by the reception desk. I think that some people booking this hotel will have seen erroneous and misleading information on some websites. It may also be confused with another hotel with the same name in Paddington , photos of which have also been wrongly displayed. Gresham Hotel , Bloomsbury, is a two star hotel, without a lift and it does not serve breakfast. Check in is at three pm. I have stayed in five star establishments but when I don't want to pay five star prices I am happy to put up with little knocks in the paintwork - usually caused by customers and their luggage anyway. I am booking a third stay .

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Hollz87
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that I have stayed in a lot of hotels over the years and have put up with a few dives in my time, but never have I seen a place like this. How they can justify charging Â£83 per night for a twin ensuite is beyond me. We arrived early and were told that we had to wait to check in at 3pm which was okay as they advised us that we could leave our case there. Our cases were left next to a filing cabinet in a tiny corridor behind the desk. This was sort of unprofessional but i didn't see it as that big a deal. Came back later and got given room 56 which is located in the annex. The room was tiny, sheets were unclean and smelled, shower had hairs etc in it, a bath towel each but no hand towel? Room looked like it was in dire need of some tlc there wasn't even any duvets. Went back and politely asked to switch rooms, we were offered another room in the building, number 12 which upon first impression looked okay, until we saw the bathroom and a pile of dead flies in the shower. At this point we went back and asked for a refund. Clearly the guy didn't believe us because he checked, came back and said "oh it's only some flies!" probably not very wisely I lost my temper at this point and had a huge argument with them. Extremely rudely they spoke about my friend and I in Indian to each other while we were stood right there. Apparently refunds take 8-12 days to go through. Again something I found difficult to believe as we had only done the transaction on a card machine a half hour earlier. The guy tried to tell us he was charging us the first night because we had "used" the room. We were in the room for half an hour trying to decide how best to go abort complaining about it. Do not stay at this hotel, I don't see a refund happening and they are the most rude unhelpful people I have ever met in my life. Hotel should be shut down. It should be criminal to run a place that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking ...”
Reviews.Author: Crono_Ng
Reviews.Content: Totally different from what's shown on website. Poorly managed rooms with old furnitures. My luggages being moved to the lobby without any notice on the 3rd day. Asked the receptionist and they said they were changing the carpet of the room so they moved my luggage. Totally unacceptable, hotel staffs should NOT do their room maintenance when there's guest staying in the room. The central heater doesnt even on during my last night staying in the hotel, and there's no proper duvet in the room (they are using blanket and comforter cover as blanket) unless requested. Proper door lock should be invested (I didnt even feel safe living in the room). Perhaps I should be thankful that I didnt got bite by any bedbugs after reading the previous reviews :) Good location, fair service, and horrible room condition

Reviews.Title: “Ridden with filth!”
Reviews.Author: stinkytom
Reviews.Content: I don't feel I can particularly add much more that hasnt already been said about this place but lets just say I have about 7 bites on my back, neck, head and foot the size of a 2p coin!! It was infested with bed bugs or fleas or something nasty. The shower was like standing under a leaking drain pipe. The whole place looked like it was ready for demolition! I chose it because it's location was very convenient for my office and as I was attending an awards ceremony that night so it seemed a good cheap option but now I wish I'd just slept on the street-it would've been cleaner! Avoid at all costs....

Reviews.Title: “OK but not coming back”
Reviews.Author: NaomiMoenen
Reviews.Content: We had the room at the top floor, number 44. Before it got turned in a room, it was an attick I believe. We had no doornob and the room was very small. We opted to move the beds together but we found a lot of JUNK under the beds, such as socks, candy, money, dust, hairs and other dirty stuff. The bathroom and toilet were acceptable but be sure to wear slippers and carry desinfectant with you! We bought our own beddings, we didn't want to catch scabies but it turned out to be ok. The personnel was not so nice. It is very close to Oxford Street and the pubs so that was great.

Reviews.Title: “you pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: si2229
Reviews.Content: I was in london over night and looking for acomendation, and working on a tight budget. it is extreamly basic, as the picture shows, shared toilet as described, few wierd people about lol but it was just a bed i needed so for the price and location this did the job for me perfectly. Had seen some dodgy pictures on here of rooms really bad with ripped carpet, and decandent shower. but my room was ok and the shower looked like it had been very recently maintened, didnt actaully use it, but had a quick look. The guy on the desk was good, could c i was tired and gave me a room near by, then a map when i said i was heading out so that was gud, check out eleven, handy. from the reviews i saw and people at the hotel i saw staying i thin k the main clientel is travelers from abroad usin it as a stop gap. Apart from some drunks coming in bout 330am banging on the doors, but wot do u expect really, lol the stay did the job just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Severe case of bed bugs, flees and overall dirty. Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: anonymousw00w
Reviews.Content: Severe case of bed bugs, flees and overall dirty. Avoid at all cost!!! Your health is more important than cheap rates at this hotel. Spent more time and money getting rid of the bugs I got there than I saved by not spending the night at another hotel. Thought I would avoid this kind of thing if I did not stay at the youth hostel but I guess I was very wrong, perhaps the hostel would have been a better option

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Peppivankokki
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty, furnature should have been replaced decades ago. Very poor telly reception. Room was left unlocked after room service. No breakfast service in hotel, but I guess you wouldn't want to have breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “For the price... worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: gikeo
Reviews.Content: have to say I work in 5* hotels... but for the price and location what to want more in London! I go often to visit friends and always book with bookings.com choosing the cheap and comfy to be able to run around the city and have a place to sleep..i had very bad experience and had to change hotel... but. This hotel.. is perfect!!! not beautifull but do you need to stay in the room if not only for a rest and a shower before enjoying fab London!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again..”
Reviews.Author: KBH-Aarhus
Reviews.Content: I just came home from a few days in London with my daughter. The plan for a hotel were "a place to sleep", as most of the day shold be spent shopping. At first glance the room was OK. Beds, a sink, closets and a tv. Every night waterpipes were cracking so it took hours to fall asleep, and the walls were so thin, that you could hear what were being said two rooms over. They promised to take careof the pipe problem, but nothing happend. Next time ill spend the few extra punds on a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: mrboldies
Reviews.Content: The room was so bad we actually walked out and booked a room at the St.Giles hotel just up the road instead. After much complaining we were told we could have a refund, but we have yet to see it. Initially they were reluctant to let us have a refund and tried to give us another room (despite having already told us they were fully booked!) The room they showed us had not even been cleaned since the last guests and was just as bad as the first one. The first room was filthy, with chewing gum on the carpet and cobwebs on the windows. The bathroom had a large window with no curtain, so people in the hallway could see right in to the bathroom! When we complained we were told not to worry because no one used the hallway. We knew this was untrue as we'd seen other guests there and also the room was directly opposite the kitchen!! This is the worst place I've seen and I've stayed in some pretty cheap motels.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was like stale bread. Having been toasted and buttered it was edible.”
Reviews.Author: Headley1974
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews I decided to keep an open mind prior to booking the room, as people tend to judge by their own standards or by what they are accustomed to. Having searched the net, I realised that trying to get a room in central London was going to be expensive. The budget I had for a double room for me and my mate was Â£60. We wanted to be as close to Leicester square as possible, and found that rooms around this area cost around double and upwards. The nearest alternatives were Victoria, paddington and kings cross, which would have meant an expensive taxi ride after a night out. The Gresham Hotel is in the perfect location. Two mins to walk to Tottenham court rd. And 5 mins or so to Leicester square. Now having checked in we were allocated a room on the 4th floor. This meant a steep climb up three flights of stairs. Which is great if you want to lose a few pounds but not if your unfit. The female receptionist wasn't friendly or engaging but didn't come across rude either. She handed over the key and advised that it had to be returned when leaving the hotel which I found really strange, however she advised that this because they opened 24 hours. My immediate concern was for my valuables therefore I made sure that I kept wallet etc on my person. The room was a decent size twin. With a basin And small table. The decor was basic. There were clean towels and bedding. The room had a faint musty smell which you didn't notice after a while. Outside there was a shower room and a toilet. Both were clean but the shower had a faint odour. I believe this was coming from the shower trap/drain or possibly the curtain. It was'nt unpleasant. Due to the fact that my friend has trouble climbing stairs as he's a big lad I decided to request a change of room as I was meeting him a few hours later. By this time there was a different receptionist called Ryan. He was fantastic and accommodating. He gave me the choice of two rooms a double and a twin on the first floor. They were both clean but smaller rooms. The double was a reasonable size. And the twin was long and narrow with the beds back to back. I chose the twin as didn't fancy sharing a bed with my mate! My only gripe with this room was that the mirror light was broken which was frustrating as it was difficult to shave as it was getting dark. Also the bed was a bit springy for me but my mate was happy. As it was a warm day we had to leave the window open, so you could hear traffic. But as we both strolled in at 4.am it didn't matter as we were both out for the count! The only annoying thing was that we had to wait 10 mins after buzzing the door to be let back in the hotel. Overall I would say that Â£55 for a double room was excellent considering the location. If we had elected for an en suite room it would have cost Â£75. The hotel next door was charging Â£125 for a double. Now this hotel has zero luxuries but offers cheap accommodation in the heart of London on the exclusive Bloomsbury rd. If your prepared to lower your standards for a night or two then I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It was clean but very basic. No breakfast, kettle, mugs, glasses or iron. What you see is what u get. Now I can't swear to this but I think I may have been bitten once or twice, however this happens occasionally in my own house as I have two dogs and a cat, so it's an occupational hazard and therefore didn't phase me. To put things in to perspective I noticed several homeless people sleeping rough on the streets in the early hours of the morning. To those who say it would be better to sleep outside haven't got a clue. There are no luxuries at this hotel but if you want affordable accommodation at the heart of the city then it's perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not Cheerful!!”
Reviews.Author: flic87
Reviews.Content: The only thing thats good to say about this hotel is the location. Haven't stayed in such a bad room since university and I lived with 7 boys! Dirty and badly maintained rooms and toilets, shower and tv didnt work and I didn't dare sleep under the sheets but I didn't need to because I was so hot without any air conditioning or fans. I will not stay again and if you are paying anything more than Â£25 a night for the rooms you are over paying!

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant pets”
Reviews.Author: gabie3
Reviews.Content: excellent location and the rooms in the back are more quiet than expected ... but that's about all ... actually I hadn't expected much for that price but after having been eaten alive by bed bugs I feel obliged to warn others ... I am not so sure if they'll make the room "pet-free" before renting it out to someone else again ... please check thoroughly or rather choose another hotel, there are plenty of others in the neighbourhood where I haven't had SUCH an experience before ... the staff was rather OK in the beginning but after my complaint they were rather uncooperative and very reluctant to pay back the price of the room ... but in the end they did ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tan84
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Gresham with 4 female friends. After reading the below reviews we were all worried about what state we would have to stay in but it wasnt as bad as we thought! We were Â£60 each for 2 nights through Booking.com and we got what we paid for. We were allowed to drop off our suitcases in the morning and were told we could check-in from 3pm, you are only a 10 minute walk to Oxford Street so we werent too bothered. When we did check-in we were told we were in the annex which means you have to drop off your key everytime you go out and someone has to let you in when you return. On first impression the rooms weren't very pretty, the bathroom was small but newly refurbished which we were very pleased about. The rooms are in desperate need of a lick of paint, if this was done it would make a big difference. Our landing was stinking of smoke and our fire place looked dirty, even though it seemed to have been dusted. Beds were ok and for a girly weekend where we only slept and got ready there it was fine. If i got the same deal i would stay again. Location is a massive plus point and there is plenty to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for London”
Reviews.Author: GailGS
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for two nights. The front office staff was very nice and helped us with directions and calling a cab. The room was not beautiful but clean and had a big window. The bathroom was very clean. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that we had to stay in the Annex up the street. We had to leave the key at the front desk each time we wanted to go somewhere. It was a little annoying to have them unlock the door to the annex everytime. It felt very safe though. This isn't the most beautiful place but is the cheapest you can find in a great location. London is expensive so we were happy that we saved on the hotel and went to the theater. They are pretty close to this area!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable and depressing!”
Reviews.Author: Markhall61
Reviews.Content: Miserable reception, not allowed to have a key to get in to the Annexe so had to ask the grumpy staff to open the door for us every time. Tatty carpets, paper thin walls, shabby and musty smelling. No amenities in the room, not even tea or coffee, no phone, Â£10 deposit needed to borrow hairdryer and Iron but no ironing board so had to iron on the scruffy carpet. All this for the best part of Â£400 for 5 nights, a disgrace. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Thilthy, flea-bitten hotel, please avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: dor57
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in that hotel and omg I wish I hadn't! It was the worst hotel experience of my life! The lady at the reception desk wasn't very engaging but it was nothing compared to the state of the room: the carpet was so old that there were big holes in there; the room was smelling of dirt and old dust; the room hadn't been cleaned before we arrived, only the sheets had been changed but we soon discover that there were insects in the bed (mites probably coming from the matress) !! The washbasin was dirty (hairs, toothpaste) and there were some plastic bags in the cupboard that hadn't been removed. Please have a look at the pictures, they speak for themselves. The water in the shower was really hot and every time I had a shower I had to make it quick because of my getting burnt. Positive aspect of the hotel: the location

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: tonythetourist
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, i was presented with the most unprofessional woman ever. No smile, No welcome, No courtesy. Our room was in the annex. This annex was dirty, out-dated and uncared for. Our room was number 62, the number 6 was missing from our door, the room was shabby, chintzy, uncomfortable and smelly. The view from the window was a garden of black bags and waste. The lamps did not work, the tv did not work, the cupboard had not been cleaned, the walls were dirty...need i go on?! I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 3aw7
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap hotel for a night out in London so picked this hotel. We were expecting something basic but this was dirty and had blood stains on the bedspread and on the door and carpet as well. The ceiling had water stains and the lights didn't all have covers. We chose the shared bathroom and it consisted of a toilet only with no sink and was very tiny..this was in the room. The shower was separate. You'd be better off to pay just a few pounds more to get a good deal on a hotel with hotwire or something rather than stay here. Also beware that the hotel states they have no liability for any items stolen from your room.

Reviews.Title: “what a disgusting place to stay - NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: nosybe_panther
Reviews.Content: what a horrible place to stay. i picked this hotel from booking.com due to the location (near the tube and british museum) and the reviews. we arrived at 1500, there were bags of rubbish all over lobby area. we were given a choice of 2 rooms (en suite) the first was in the basement next to a kitchen area, it was dark and smelt strongly of damp as we walked back up the stairs we could clearly see into the kitchen - the walls were dirty. and the area looked grubby and not cared for. we agreed that we would have the second choice (it couldn't possibly be worse could it?). we had to pay before going to the room in the annex just down the road, the room was on the top floor with a cupboard as the en suite - just a toilet and shower, the walls were dirty, the room smelt and looking out the window we could see a mountain of rubbish down in the back courtyard. me and partner quickly agreed that we would NOT be staying here for the night as we felt very unsafe and didn't want to leave our belongings there while we went out. we quickly phoned some more local hotels, luckily for us there was 1 room left at another, we quickly made our departure into the fresh air. when i went to hand the key back there were 5 members of staff all stood around the reception desk, i handed the key back and said that i wouldn't be back, i was asked very rudely by an angry gentleman WHY? i felt very intimidated by all the staff standing there staring at me like i was some kind of idiot. I asked about the refund procedure, and was told that i would be getting one, another member of staff then said it wasn't up to them they will have to get hold of there head office. i asked for the number to speak to them myself or an address i could write to and was told that they only have a fax number for them. overall this hotel had NO customer service skills, DIRTY and SMELLY rooms and reception area. i would never recommend anyone to stay here and have personally stayed at better hostels

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, but a completely abysmal hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: SLW28
Reviews.Content: I would like to start with the positives - the staff were friendly and helpful, the hotel is accessible 24hrs and the location is right in the centre of London, a stone's throw away from the British Museum. However, the negatives undoutbedly outweigh the positives. The noise from the road made it difficult to sleep. The room was very pricey considering it's state - at the time we booked, they were charging over Â£70 a night. The hotel is in need of a complete refurbishment, the interior is very dated and generally shabby. The carpet in our room was worn, there were stains on the ceiling & the television set looked like it was at least 10 years old. It seems that the place has been somewhat neglected. We had the luxury of an ensuite, however the shower was cold which was very unpleasant. We only stayed one night after paying for two as we couldn't bear another cold shower or sleepless night. It is such a shame as the hotel has so much potential and is in a prime location, with the right care & attention, better soundproofing & hot water, this could be a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hell is real!”
Reviews.Author: damn_you_gresham
Reviews.Content: A few months ago, me and a friend decided to go on a trip to london. We were so exited to go and when we booked this hotel on booking.com it looked a small but friendly hotel on a good location. the rating was a decent 7, sow we had no worries. When we arrived i immediately felt uncomfortable, we had to ring the bell first, and a unfriendly, angry looking woman opened the door. she looked at our booking information and told us we had to come back at 3.00 p.m., so we did, this time an (again) unfriendly man opened the door en told us to wait in this filthy waiting room, a bag of garbage was placed in this room and a strange looking girl was sleeping in one of the torn chairs. after what looked like ages we were told to come to the lobby and we had to pay immediately before we had to see the rooms. What a mistake! We went up the stairs to the 3th floor after receiving our key and on every floor the filthy laundry of the night before just layed on the ground. When we were going to our room some of the staff where yelling at each other for unknown reasons. Like if thats wasn't enough, we entered our room (which had no bathroom or toilet, only this dirty wash basin). The room was just big enough to place in 2 beds, people had been writing on the walls, the room wasn't cleaned, the mirror was filthy,... we decided not to spend 2 nights here and to go search another hotel, we didn't succeeded and we left london, because of this hotel, the same day we arrived Thank you very much people of the gresham, for this wonderfull london experience, i realy don't know why this place is still running. WORST HOTEL EVER!

Reviews.Title: “you can't imagine”
Reviews.Author: guest1Belgium
Reviews.Content: this was the most horrible trip i made. first off al we came there at 11.00 and the say we have to come back at 15.00 becaus the worker was not there to register us. when we came there at 15.00 we got the same (lady) and then she made the registering. why not 11.00? we had no shower on 3the floor, no clean room, poor beds, also not clean. and afther whole day of walking, i smelled better then the room! when we booked we saw good pictures, and fine rating on booking.com next time i have such hotel, i better burn it down so nobody ave to sleep in that horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Flea Pit”
Reviews.Author: ragsnben
Reviews.Content: Please Please Please do not stay at this filthy hotel unless you are very very skint and do not mind staying in disgusting surroundings. I made the ultimate mistake by not looking on Trip Adviser before going to stay. From the moment we walked into the reception area I started to itch with disgust at the disgusting smell and sight of thick dirt on all surfaces. The lounge was filthy with ripped shabby suite and when taken down to see the room in the depths of the basement I new I couldn't let my dogs sleep there never mind myself. I would rather have slept on Trafalger Square for the night. How in hell they are allowed to still function as a hotel I will never know, what are the council thinking and what our visitors from abroad think of british hotels after staying there God knows. The odd ones who have put positive remarks on this site must have very low expectations of life to be able to say anything other than disgusting. PLEASE avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “An old friend”
Reviews.Author: cubancrisis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed @ the Greshan since the early 80's. You can't beat the price for the location however this last visit was sad because the old place is so neglected and what was a mediocre yet filling breakfast is no more.I will find a new place to stay even at the cost of a few more quid. i will miss it.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: pats07
Reviews.Content: firstly we had a problem with our booking and the receptionist was so rude nad unhelpful, just kept blaming us for mistake! we gots rooms eventually....not the same as we had booked. the rooms were disgusting, 4 of us stayed in a family room which was so dirty. the other two stayed in a double which didnt hav a toilet or shower, and it was absolutely tiny. the location is pretty crap too, its a good walk away from nearest tube station and not near anythin! I wouldnt recommend anyone to stay here, its cheap but not worth it at all! dont even know how it is classed as a hotel, i've stayed in nicer hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly positive”
Reviews.Author: Student3003
Reviews.Content: The hotel consists of two seperate houses, only one of them has a reception. They are a few steps away from each other. First we (2) were shown a room in the part without the reception but we didn't like the fact that every time we leave the hotel we had to walk back to the other house and leave the key there. So we asked for another room. We got one in the hotel part with the reception on the ground floor. It was big, tidy, facing the backyard (very quiet) and contained a double-bed, a single one, two chairs, a TV, bathroom and wardrobe with extra blankets. Although the heaters were switched on, at night it became a bit cold due to the big windows which were a bit draughty. The beds were made and the towels were exchanged every day. The staff was very friendly all the time. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast but there are two Starbucks within 3 minutes walking distance, so no problem. Also the hotel is surrounded by very nice restaurants and less than 5 minutes away from the British Museum. It is definitely a perfect location for tourists. Next tube is 5 minutes - Tottenham Court Rd. All in all it was the perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE AT ALL! IT IS THE WORST THING I HAVE EVER SEEN!!!”
Reviews.Author: hullian
Reviews.Content: Having booked a weekend in London for my friends 21st in may for january 2010 we were under the impression that we had found a bargain for this hotel. The pictures looked nice, however when u actually arrive you will see this to false advertisment! When we arrived having booked 7 months in advanced we were told 3 of us were in the hotel and 3 of us were in the annex which is a seperate building! We entered the annex and to our horror it was DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!! it was filthy, mouldy, dusty and smelly. Totally neglected. We then decided to go and complain. We were offered an attic room which was still far away from our friends. There room in the hotel was no better but as we had just paid we couldnt get our money back for 48hours!!! Then man then offered us a big room in the basement and we decided to take it, it was GROSE but we all wanted to be together as we felt very unsafe here. They were only two single beds so the man pushed them together and then made another bed out of 3 mattresses, you can imagine how uncomfortable this was! So 6 of us stayed it 2 single beds and a mattress made bed!!! One of the mattresses had a huge blood stain on it which was grose! Going down to the basement you can see just how unhygenic it is, the kitchen was a mess, there was dirty laundry everywhere and the smell the whole hotel had was absolutly disgusting it made us balk! So as you can imagine we didnt sleep well and now we are all itching and reading other reviews people had said they have been bitten by bed bugs, well this has proved correct as it appears this has happend to us. This hotel should be closed down, they should pay people to stay here, The staff were unhelpful and rather moody and clearly didnt loo after the hotel as it was a mess and very neglected. It didnt even deserved one star!!!!! MORE THAN TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not very cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: swinkum
Reviews.Content: On arrival was surprised to be asked to pay cash because, I was told. there was a workman on site that needed to be paid - I paid half in cash the rest on my card. The room was clean-ish - but the wall lights had been garotted and to use the TV which was perched on top of the wardrobe I had to climb on a chair (where is health & safety when you need them?!). I have never seen such a tiny bathroom - excuse me being indelicate but it is the only bathroom I have ever seen where you could use the toilet, wash your hands and have a shower at the same time! The people on reception were friendly enough and when all is said and done, it was very, very cheap!.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay there!!! A Nightmare and NOT SAFE!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler1000_11
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I ever wrote just to warn other travelers about this hotel. ItÂ´s the most dirtiest place you can imagine. Everything is full of dust and the room smelled so bad. But the worst thing is that it is NOT SAFE. I locked all our trolley bags and put it in the wardrobe. After the whole day out I took one of the bags and it was open. I went to the reception and told the girl working there what happened. Her answer was: there was nobody in the room after 3pm (whatever this means?!?). IÂ´m pretty sure that members of the staff opened the bag. The entire reception is full of stickers: "We are not responsible for stolen items from your room". 1 sign is common but 20 of them looked already suspicious to us. This was also a reason why I carried everything beside clothes with me the whole day but I dont want to imagine what would have happened if I had a camera or a laptop in the bag I left in the room...

Reviews.Title: “terrible mistake”
Reviews.Author: cat3appr
Reviews.Content: Too bad I didn't check the reviews about this hotel. Dirty hall with foreign front desk people who didn't know a thing about anything. Small, dirty room, no shower... had to walk to another floor to get it, and cold water.... Better camping in hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG HELL 2”
Reviews.Author: julawula
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to chance having such a bad case of beg bug bites that you have to go to an emmergency clinic with suspected infection/poisoning - then don't stay here. Do not be fooled by being asked to check the room - ours looked clean - it was only in the night that the bugs surfaced. I am in AGONY and no supposed saving on london prices is worth this! I should be suing!

Reviews.Title: “Shock at first but got better - location was great”
Reviews.Author: Kissa_75
Reviews.Content: ROOM: The room was on the third floor (street level as zero) on the street side of the building and it was for three people. There was a water tap and sink in the room. The drain smelled really bad all the time and also made our clothes stink. The dresser was broken and we didn't put anything in the wardrobe in fear that there would be little insects or something in it (after all, no bugs or flying animals detected). The carpet and the curtains were tidy. The noise from the street was horrible even with earplugs on, but the scenery was fine. Nothing got stolen, although we didn't leave anything valuable in the room. Plusses: rbig room, quiet neighbours, view, price. Minuses: smell, carpet, noise from the street. SERVICE: The service was kind but the staff spoke only little English with thick asian accent. The hinge of the room door made loud noise in disturbing level. Even after asking for oil and a promise that the staff would deal with it, nothing happened. Plusses: there was always someone at the desk. Minuses: English skills, not responding to the request. FASCILITIES: Toilet stank heavily of sewer and there was no hand washing. The shower was neat but the water pressure was poor. Sometimes it was difficult to get hot water and the water mixer (hot + cold) did not work well (was there any??). One water shortage happened on Friday when there was no water income so e.g. toilet seats were filled with human waste. Plusses: neat shower Minuses: no hand wash in toilet, smell. OVERALL REVIEW: The location of this hotel is great. You can walk almost everywhere from here, e.g. we walked to Westminster, Soho, City and Tower Bridge. We didn't need public transport at all and stayed almost a week. With this price you cannot expect much from your hotel so I think it was worthy. If you are looking for only a place to crash after sight seeing or partying, I recommend. If you are looking for a room where you stay in, this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO LEAVE WITH NO SUITCASE OR BELONGINGS!!”
Reviews.Author: purple23England
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel cause it was central to everything..but its an absolute [--] hole. we stayed in the annexe room 54 (i think) The bathroom was new and clean and the room had a tv but that was the only good thing about it everything else ROTTON the carpet hadnt been hoovered for about 4 months the room absolutally stunk the wardrobe mite as well have not been there, cobwebs hanging from the ceiling, the curtains were old smelly and disgusting they were hanging off the rail and when you tried to open them you looked on to what is meant to be a yard but was like a rubbish tip with a shed with smashed windows! On the 2nd day we had been out alday only to come back to find my mobile phone had been stolen from inside my case in a sock from a double locked room and even a main front door which you can only get in if you have a key. There were no signs of a break in or forced entry and the windows were all locked but they had a good rake around!! When i went off to report this to reception there was another girl standing who was upset she said her laptop had been stolen and her locked case with all her clothes in so poor thing was left only in the clothes she was standing in!! Who could do such a thing! What i dont understand is that i had the key on me all day as the front door of the main hotel was locked when i went to hand it in! Im aware the cleaner will have a key if thats what you call her or shall we say bedmaker cause thats all she did! I definately think the people who work at the hotel have some sort of thieving scam going on! When I asked reception to speak to the manager they said they only have contact by fax(dodgy for a start) I mean who and which hotel is ever run like this none i know of and i work in the travel industry ! it just gets better... I advised them of what had happened and they pointed at a sign saying they arent resposible for anything been lost of stolen which is fair enough but not when a room is looked with 2 locks and you have a main door locked too( shuley they are) so when i asked for the number for the local police station the guy looked at me and said he didnt know it so i asked for a phone book so i stood looking for it ( how unhelpful) when asked which station was the closest he shrugged his shoulders!!The staff here are so unhelpful and dont seem to understand english either I called the police told reception and they werent even bothered. Seriously I would never stay here again and wouldnt advise anyone to even try it! I would believe the reviews you read on here its a hell hole... Would say pay that little bit extra and stay in the travelodge or somewhere which at least where you know when you leave the room your suit case and your belongings will be safe!! I am definately not a snob and have travelled the world and have stayed in far better hostels...I wouldnt give the hotel/ dive my money and neither should you!!! feel free to contact me and i will reply!

Reviews.Title: “No bad at all, dont know what all the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: hairyclarey1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a night as 4 of us were going out for a night in London and needed a place that was cheap and close to the places we wanted to go and easy to get to. I found this place online and it was the cheapest I could find so we booked 2 twin rooms. After booking we read the reviews and all were really bad!!! We started getting worried!! We decided to stay there anyway as were were only going to be there for 1 night. When we got there we were surprised that the place is clean and tidy, the staff were helpful and our room was perfect for what we needed it for. The room was clean so was the shower and toliet (although these were seperated from our room and shared). It is just a basic hotel with basic rooms and facilities. I'm not sure if the other people who have written reviews were expecting a 5 star palace but you get what you pay for and this place was perfect for us for the cheapest price in a fantastic location. No complaints at all. Not sure what everyone else was making such a fuss about!! I would certainly come back and stay there again for a few nights if we were going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, Room Not Cleaned, Broken Glass”
Reviews.Author: Trot_the_World006
Reviews.Content: The Gresham is in a good location at a reasonable price. However, it is a bit unnerving to see bedbugs crawling around when one's mate is asleep--and to see the mass of bites that grow on the skin a day or two later. The shared showers were not cleaned, and a large window of one of the toilets was broken in many places. It was very difficult to communicate with the staff--who seemed to have good intentions, but could not speak much English. The sheets were clean, but many simple things that just required attending to were left undone. Example: the towel rack was broken off, leaving only a stub on which to try to hang the towel. Ex 2: Heavy dust on the upper part of the small closet (i.e., no place to put the suitcase). After one day, I thought, "We could stay here again, maybe." After three days and the welts appearing, and several forays with smiling, but ineffective hotel staff, we thought, "Not even possible." We are experienced travelers who have stayed in these types of hotels all over the world. This was among the least healthy places we've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “We should have read the reviews first!!!”
Reviews.Author: HaroldDublin
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked a room in The Gresham as it was cheap, and central for our shopping weekend. Our room was in the basement....it reminded me of the "One foot in the Algarve" episode. Here Victor Meldrew and friends, on arriving at their holiday destination in the dark, ask local police directions to their appartment. However Victor and co. think that there is some misunderstanding when the policeman shows them into a dark, damp room with basic furniture and paint peeling off the walls. Surely there had been a misunderstanding!!! Why had they been thrown into jail?...........But no, when the light of day dawns....its their holiday appartment!! Well, luckily my friends and i have a sense of humour. If we hadn't laughed we would have cried. The waste paper basket hid the hole in the carpet...but we found it! The shower curtain had mould on it. The 70's pale blue bathroom suite should have been ripped out in the 70's. To be honest, we were very selective about what we touched!!! Oh, and there was only 3/4 of a roll of loo paper. At night we all clutched menthol impregnated tissues to our noses to mask the musky smell of the room. However...the bed was fairly comfortable, the beds got made and it was cheap and central. But not one smiling friendly member of staff. When we asked for a taxi to be called, we were told "could you do it yourselves as we can't ring out" WHAT WOULD YOU DO IN AN EMERGENCY???

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: RebelYankee
Reviews.Content: Despite its low cost and good location, the Gresham Hotel should be avoided. It's noisy, smelly, dirty, and unsafe. When I was there, the street door didn't close properly, the floors and door hinges creaked, there were stains on the carpet and wall, the narrow twin room (6' by 15') was hot and plagued by traffic noise from the street, there was standing water and mildew in the shower, no toilet tissue, poor breakfast, and a staff that pretended not to speak English so they could rip me off for a 6-night reservation even after I fled this hell-hole after only two nights. Sleep on a bench in Russell Square rather than stay at this "hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Tink67
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever stayed in. You are charged on arrival not when you book which I had'nt realised. Our room was in the annexe which is a building a few doors down. There is no lift and we were 3 floors up. The room was dirty, the curtains were hanging off the rails, the bathroom door was not fixed properly on the en-suite(if you can call it an en-suite!), the sink was cracked in the bathroom and you couldn't use the sink unless the bathroom door was open anyway as there was not enough space, the shower encloser was dirty and mouldy. The breakfast was certainly not what I would describe as a continental breakfast with only luke warm tea & coffee, orange juice out of plastic cups, one choice of cereal and no choice for hot breakfast it just appeared on the table - small portion of tasteless scrambled egg, 2 warmed pieces of bread that were supposed to be toast, one roll of ham and one slice of cheese. There was not even proper knives available only fish knives!The staff hardly spoke a word of English - in fact they hardly spoke - apart from the polite girl who first booked us in but she was gone again when we went back to reception 20 minutes later. The rooms look NOTHING like the ones shown on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel- DO NOT STAY HERE, ESPECIALLY ROOM 1!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loopyboo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from one night in The Gresham Hotel- luckily for us it was only one night!! Be aware that even though you give your card details online, you do not pay until you get there which we were not aware of so we were Â£70 down on spending money before we even got out the door! The language barrier between ourselves and the staff was awful. It was very hard to communicate anything. Also the staff were quite rude and very unhelpful. We had book a twin en suite room. The beds were small, and the matressess were terrible, all the springs had gone in mine so it was very uncomfortable. They didnt have duvets, we slept under a wooley blanket and a double bed throw doubled over. I overheard another customer complaining that they had booked a double room and turned up to a twin, the receptionist said they did not have any double beds at all and would push two singles together for them. So beware if expecting a double room! Its in a great location for all sight seeing, theatres and public transport so that is one bonus. The 'en suite' was tiny, dull and dirty. The sink and bedee' had cracks in them, the shower was small and rusty and we had no hot water in shower or from the taps. So it was a cold shower/wash or nothing. Now the worst bit- during the night I heard a rustling in a bag on the floor, turned on the light and saw a huge mouse run over to the chair and up my coat. I was horrified, woke my boyfriend and asked him to keep an eye on it whilst I went to tell reception. The gentleman behind reception spoke even less English than the man that booked us in. He said he was unable to move us to a different room, for some reason I could not understand. He came down to the room on my insistance so he could get the mouse out. By that time it had gone under the floor boards through a hole by the radiator. I refused to stay in the room and all he said was ' it probably wont come out again!!' I insisted he move us to another room, which he did in the end, but it was 5 flights of stairs up, no lift and no help with luggage from him. I asked him what time the manager was in the next day and he said 7am. When we got to the new room we realised it was not en suite and we had to share the bathroom and shower. Which was not what we paid for. The beds up here were even worse, there was a sink in the room that was persistanly dripping no matter what we did, the window did not close properly and there was stil no hot water. In the morning we did not want to stay for breakfast as the room with the mouse was right next door to the kitchen so god knows what it was like in there. When we checked out it was the same gentleman that had checked us in. He was not aware of the mouse or room switching that had happened during the night. I explained all of this to him and he said there was nothing he could do as the manager was not in until 5pm!! A very different time to the 7am that the gentleman in the night had said! We happend to be walking near the hotel at 4pm later that day so decided to go in and see if the manager was there, she was. She also was not aware of the complaint that we had put in at check out. So I had to explain everything again to her. She then said there was nothing she could do because all complaints have to be dealt with at check out. She said to email the hotel and see what happens. Sorry this review is sooo long, I just wanted to save some poor other unsuspecting tourist the same ordeal as we had. We totally regret staing there and we are not going to let it go until we get some kind of refund. Please do not hesitate to contact me for any more details.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EssexSkipdip87
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel or should i say hostel, with other friends, we had two rooms in the Annex. Where can i start. The Smell was disgusting smelt like dead rats, the curtains where hanging off the walls, the toilet door was broken, the shower was small. the water was cold and it got all the walls wet apart form the person in the shower. The floor had no mats so very slipery, the sink only had cold water. the mirros were dirty, the beds were uncomfortabe with no blankets. the carpets were dirty, went to use the toilet downstairs had no lighting. It cost Â£95 a night. did not even want to chance the breakfast. we had to leave our keys at recpetion when we went out. i told another friend to go and ask for our key to see what the security was like. They passed it over with no question. I would never stay in this hotel again even if they paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: flyawayagain
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel for a two-day stay in London and she felt awful when it turned out to be a total disaster. I don't mind so much that it was very basic but we found the room to be completely disgusting - dirty, greasy and to top it all I found a pill a previous guest had dropped on the rug. And I am not entirely sure whether the sheets were fresh. Unfortunately we had booked an ensuite room where the toilet and shower were outside the room which added to the adventure. I am glad we were able to laugh about it at the time -after all it was only a weekend trip- but I would not go there again if they paid me.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep at Euston Station”
Reviews.Author: qwerty14
Reviews.Content: what a sh*t-hole. I had booked a twin room with on-suite bathroom My wife and I were offered two rooms. In one there was no hot water. We were told this before hand and the other had hot water but the shower was in pieces on the cublcle floor. (The same shower as in the photos)Neither looked as though they had been cleaned for a week . We were then offered an upgrade in there sister hotel this was mariganly better . Well it had a working shower (just) and hot water. Most of the guest at both hotels were forgieners. I can,t help thinking what they must have felt about staying in Britain and the damage hotels like this does to the London toursit industry

Reviews.Title: “Well at least the toilet flushed!”
Reviews.Author: wallywombat
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews before arriving so I wasn't expecting much but the results were far worse than I thought. The curtains were hanging off the rail, the shower was dirty and the shower head attachment was broken leaving the shower dangling into the TINY shower tray. The room size was adequate and fortunately I was at the rear away from the traffic noise however there were two spotlights in the room with no visible means of turning them on. This is a desperately sad hotel in dire need of some serious tlc which I doubt it will ever have. With the general run-down grimy feel of the place I wasn't inspired to have breakfast so I didn't! I would happily pay more for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mistake”
Reviews.Author: Rednosedcat
Reviews.Content: Through work, I have probably stayed in around a thousand (yes, I know) different hotels all over Europe and â€“ perhaps â€“ around 20 in various price ranges in London. Itâ€™s rare that I would rate a hotel experience as terrible (one or two perhaps out of those thousand hotels) but, unfortunately, our recent stay in the Gresham was truly awful. I wonâ€™t bore you with my personal take on the atmosphere at breakfast â€“ for example â€“ but I would criticise the Gresham, compared to other hotels available in the area, for the following reasons which I think are pretty fundamental points for a pleasant stay: - Location - Value for money - Cleanliness - Security The Gresham is located on Bloomsbury at â€“ perhaps â€“ the noisiest junction on the street; particularly if you are based in the annex as we were. Hence, traffic noise surpasses the point of irritating which you may find at the Jesmond, Arosfa or Ridgemount and reaches the â€˜unbearableâ€™. In terms of value for money, the Gresham is more expensive than neighbouring hotels, but offers less right across the board. Perhaps the only advantage is the shorter walk down into 7 Dials. Our room, and the various corridors and stairwells we saw, were dirty. The clump of hair we found on the bathroom floor next to the unemptied bin was so big it could have been given a name and a collar and we could have taken it to the vets for its shots. We didnâ€™t venture into the shower; we thought it was safer not to. One of the three pillows was confined to the floor as we were sure that it had served the previous residents of our room. Finally, and perhaps the most serious point, security. The window of our room could not be closed. This meant that neighbouring rooms had access to our room via an adjoining balcony. This â€“ obviously â€“ bothered us, so we deposited our valuables at reception and asked to have the window fixed. When we returned, we were informed that the handyman was unavailable, and â€“ â€œsince youâ€™re only staying one nightâ€¦â€� We suggested that the problem would â€“ also â€“ apply to the next nightâ€™s guests and offered to fix the window ourselves if they gave us the tools. No tools. We headed up to the room to find the window wide open. We closed it and left the hotel, returning some hours later to find the window wide open once more. When we discovered that a piece of jewellery had been stolen from our room, we informed the hotel reception. There was no comment. There was no apology (and neither of us look like lawyers, believe me). When you book a hotel, you donâ€™t want to have to go out and buy a tool kit to secure your room. Not â€“ at least â€“ at this price, and with cheaper, and safer, hotels just a stoneâ€™s throw away. If you want cleanliness, security, location and value for money, sadly we have to say: â€œDonâ€™t stay hereâ€�. The three hotels mentioned above are FAR better, including the star budget stay for the area, the Arosfa in Gower Street. ï�Œ

Reviews.Title: “Good old Bloomsbury”
Reviews.Author: Kanteletar
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and staff is very friendly and efficient. A basic hotel room, but a very good location for a friend of culture. Not a honeymoon hotel; it's a good place to sleep for an explorer, though. No luxury, but a very nice price for a hotel in the centre of London. Everything was working fine in my stay and the staff is great. Absolutely good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint hearted”
Reviews.Author: entibob
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£50 per night on a B&B basis for 2 of us in a twin room, which I thought was a good price as the location was central, until I actually entered the premises and realised they should have paid us to stay there! Apart from the passing traffic that kept me awake until about 1.30am and woke me about 6.30am. The room was VERY basic and didnâ€™t even include drink-making facilities and is in great need of re-decorating. The carpets are possibly the original ones that were laid when the building was built, absolutely filthy and didnâ€™t even reach the side of the walls. The curtains? If thatâ€™s what you could call the filthy material that hung from broken track, were in desperate need of a good scrub in a bowl of bleach. The view from my window overlooked the busy street below as well as the gutter below that contained litter of all types including used condoms, beer cans and cigarette ends from previous occupants. The staff consisted of a mixture of races with broken English dialect and is the most miserable set of people I have met in a long time! Yet Iâ€™m sure working in that hell-hole, it would eventually break the best of personalities. Breakfast consisted of 1 slice of cheap toast, 1 slice of cheese and a piece of wafer thin ham! A cup of tea, coffee or juice. Fruit or cornflakes. So much for the great British breakfast you would expect! Toilet and showering facilities are in separate cubicles outside the room, the shower cubicle was disgusting! The entire establishment is outdated and in need of a good clean. Kim and Aggie would have a field day in this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, horrendous hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyC81
Reviews.Content: After finding this 'gem' of a hotel on a London hotels website, we were, to say the least, overjoyed at its amazing location. Arriving there late, but excited, we were greeted by a rude and patronising receptionist who threw the keys at us and let us hobble downstairs to the most horrific room I have ever been in. Unidentified yellow bugs crawled over the bathroom floor, the shower was yellow and mouldy and the carpet was truly awful. We demanded a different room and were given one in the annexe which was cleaner, but still nowhere near worth the Â£75 we had paid. You had to move sideways in the ensuite and the shower was in desperate need of a few bottles of Cif and lots of elbow grease. The curtains wouldnt close and there were no glasses to use for a well-needed drink. I wouldnt advise anyone to go there, ever. To charge any more than Â£10 a night for it is a complete disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some people say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the word 'purgatory' as one review put it, is a little over-the-top, and had me feeling very apprehensive as I boarded the train for my conference trip to London. Certainly the place is in need of serious refurbishment, there were some unidentified stains on my bed clothes and my floor wasn't level, but my experience wasn't as bad as I could have imagined (and was imagining). The showers were warm, the sheets (if not the bed cover) were clean, and the roof didn't leak. The pleasantness of the staff varied. The guy who checked me in was dismissive and unhelpful, but the young lady who made us breakfast was very attentive, and breakfast itself was just fine. If you're in need of somewhere very cheap to stay in central London and aren't too fussy, it's really not that bad. I wouldn't honeymoon there though!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here out of desperation after the hotel we booked had mice! After walking around London for 1.5 hours we really needed somewhere and ended up here. If it wasn't for my Christmas party I would have turned around and gone home. The room was very basic and dirty. You could barely move in the "bathroom" and the curtains were practically falling down. The walls were paper thin and the bed was as hard as a rock. I came home feeling filthy and spent a long time in the shower!! Someone would have to pay me far more than the Â£65 we paid to stay here again. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: DredgerWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We wanted a cheap hotel in the Bloomsbury district of London, and that's what we got! At 75 GB pounds a night and next to the British Museum, the Gresham is cheap and handy. But, the rooms are dirty, tiny and worn. No Air Conditioning and when we asked for a fan in the recent hot weather the clerk said the only fan in the building was the one he was using! We moved out to the Morgan Hotel next door which, at 90 pounds, is friendly and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: Cynta
Reviews.Content: Sorry for my bad english. But I need to say it. The hotel is horrible. The authorities would have to close it. It is old, dirty, the rooms are small. There was only one thing correct, the staff. Don't go there! Even if you have paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting there were unknown stains on the curtains and the carpet..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting there were unknown stains on the curtains and the carpet did not even touch the walls!! Unfortunately we were TRICKED into staying in this dump. We had booked into the LONSDALE it's so called sister hotel and upon arriving at the Lonsdales and paying they told us we had been moved! We only made it to the reception area which was smelly and the receptionist/owner was very unfriendly. All in all a big lesson learned, you pay peanuts you stay in a zoo!

HotelInfo.Name: Gresham Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 36 Bloomsbury Street, London WC1B 3QJ, England
